text:
EFL FAR EAST FAVES Manchester United overtake Bayern Munich as the most popular football team in China… but Bundesliga is still most followed league 
Jose Mourinho's Red Devils are the biggest hit online for Chinese football fans BY GARY STONEHOUSE Comments MANCHESTER UNITED are the most popular team online in China, according to a new report. 
The Red Devils have overtaken German giants Bayern Munich at the top of the list after the sixth edition of the Red Card was revealed. News Group Newspapers Ltd Manchester United are the most popular team online in China, according to a new report 
The study analyses the influence of 53 European clubs on China’s social media platforms. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester United news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And aside from the Bundesliga champions, the Premier League makes up the top five favourites in the Far East. 
Arsenal and Liverpool are placed jointly in third place with Manchester City sitting in fifth. related articles Mesut Ozil attracting interest from Chinese Super League as he dithers on new Arsenal contract TV Times Manchester United vs Southampton: What TV channel is the EFL Cup final on and when is it? Preview Manchester United vs Southampton: When is the EFL Cup final and what TV channel is it on? that's some feet Porto star Hector Herrera reveals foot injury in gruesome snap… having played on for 40 minutes Sam slams Gunners Samir Nasri insists Arsenal players must take the blame for failure... not under-fire Arsene Wenger TOP TEN MOST POPULAR TEAMS ONLINE IN CHINA 
1 MANCHESTER UNITED 
9 BORUSSIA DORTMUND 
10 BARCELONA 
Despite the English clubs dominating, it remains the German top-flight that is the most influential league online. 
The study has taken its data from Chinese social media platforms Weibo and WeChat as well as audience figures from live streams and the number of visitors to individual club websites in the country. 
David Hornby, the head of sport at Mailman, who produce of the annual report, told BBC Sport: “The Premier League is complacent. Its clubs have decent numbers of followers on Weibo, but not as high engagement. News Group Newspapers Ltd The sixth edition of the Red Card study confirmed United as top dogs in the Far East News Group Newspapers Ltd United are top dogs, but Arsenal, Liverpool and Man City also make it into the top five AP:Associated Press 4 Bayern Munich are in second, while the Bundesliga remains the most popular league 
“The Bundesliga clubs are far more active. The German league tells its clubs what to do, whereas the respective Premier League clubs are in control of what they do.” 
And when quizzed about United’s move to the top spot, Hornby added: “There was a gap between following and engagement. 
“United were the most followed, but Bayern were a country mile ahead regarding activity online. But United have taken big strides with fan events and a tour last year.” Memphis Depay shares the moment Manchester United make flight diversion in China
